However, unlike the spring and summer, students do not need to be present, but their student ID numbers are required! Additionally, breakfast is free, but lunch will be charged to the student’s account.

Families can apply to be part of the Free and Reduced Priced Meals program where, once approved, lunch meals will be provided for free to those that qualify.

Visit www.DUSDeats.net. for more details about our meal distribution and to apply for the Free and Reduced Priced Meal program.

A family member that recently returned from serving in Italy where he was stationed as an Airborne Paratrooper came in to the office, along with their family, to surprise his little sister with his home-coming.

All involved could not contain their emotions as the brother and sister cried and embraced each other.

We are so happy that members of our Downey Unified family were able to assist in reuniting this family! We want to thank him for his service and for letting us take part in such a special moment.

In partnership with the Downey Rose Float Association, we are so proud and honored to be the first location to have the first 1,000 origami cranes displayed within our district office.

The theme for this year’s Rose Parade is “Hope” and Downey will be building and decorating a float titled “On The Wings Of Hope.” Celebrating the Japanese tradition of folding 1,000 origami cranes to share a healing wish and hope for a brighter tomorrow, the Downey Rose Float Association has been holding crane-making events with the ultimate goal to fold 10,000 origami cranes.

We want to thank the Downey Rose Float Association for allowing Downey Unified to be a part of such a special venture. We also want to thank them for the 300 exclusive origami cranes that were made with love in memory of our own Sarah Jamison who lost her battle with cancer over the summer.
